channel.title: Fishing

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

if (NPCID == # && playerHasItem(####)) { addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addSkillXP(20 * playerLevel[10], 10); }

Something similar to that. If you want them to have a certain level, just check for playerLevel[10]. You will also probably want to add the else statement if you wish to tell the player they need a certain item.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I’m pretty sure that fishing spots are NPCs. Make the first click option add experience and the fish.

eballer48:

also whats the number for the fishing skill

playerLevel[0] = Attack playerLevel[1] = Defence playerLevel[2] = Strength playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints playerLevel[4] = Range playerLevel[5] = Prayer playerLevel[6] = Magic playerLevel[7] = Cooking playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting playerLevel[9] = Fletching playerLevel[10] = Fishing playerLevel[11] = Firemaking playerLevel[12] = Crafting playerLevel[13] = Smithing playerLevel[14] = Mining playerLevel[15] = Herblore playerLevel[16] = Agility playerLevel[17] = Thieving playerLevel[18] = Slayer playerLevel[19] = Farming playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting

item.title: Fishing

item.description:

if(objectID == 42 & HasItemAmount(307, 1) || objectID == 42 && HasItemAmount(303, 1)){
          addItem(389, 1);
     }

also whats the number for the fishing skill so i can add exp, also whats medium rate for exp?
or like should i make it || skillnumber >= 10 that way only pople 10 and under fishing skill
get shrimp… please help!! btw 42 is fishing spot 307 is fishing rod and 303 is small net
